articles.headline: CBS Is Sued by Rather Over Ouster
articles.snippet: Dan Rather asserts that CBS violated his contract by giving him insufficient airtime on “60 Minutes.”
articles.abstract: Dan Rather asserts that CBS violated his contract by giving him insufficient airtime on “60 Minutes.”
articles.lead_paragraph: Dan Rather, whose career at CBS News ground to an inglorious end 15 months ago over his role in an unsubstantiated report questioning President Bush’s Vietnam-era National Guard service, filed a lawsuit yesterday against the network, its corporate parent and three of his former superiors, including Sumner M. Redstone, the executive chairman of CBS.

articles.headline: NBC to Offer Downloads of Its Shows
articles.snippet: NBC Universal announced plans for a service to make popular NBC programs available free for computers and other devices.
articles.abstract: NBC Universal announced plans for a service to make popular NBC programs available free for computers and other devices.
articles.lead_paragraph: NBC Universal said yesterday that it would soon permit consumers to download many of NBC’s most popular programs free to personal computers and other devices for one week immediately after their broadcasts.

articles.headline: An Air Travel Activist Is Born
articles.snippet: Angry after finding herself stranded on a plane, Kate Hanni became an advocate for passenger rights. Now her campaign is taking off.
articles.abstract: Angry after finding herself stranded on a plane, Kate Hanni became an advocate for passenger rights. Now her campaign is taking off.
articles.lead_paragraph: Like thousands of American Airlines passengers last Dec. 29, Kate Hanni and her family were stuck aboard a jet for hours, out on the runway. They were hungry, bored, mad and, in the case of Flight 1348, sick of the smell wafting through the cabin from the lavatories.

articles.headline: Dubai to Buy Large Stake in Nasdaq
articles.snippet: Dubai would become the first Middle Eastern government with a large stake in an American stock exchange.
articles.abstract: Dubai would become the first Middle Eastern government with a large stake in an American stock exchange.
articles.lead_paragraph: The government-controlled stock exchange in Dubai, the fast-growing Middle East business center, is expected to announce today in Stockholm that it plans to take significant ownership in the Nasdaq stock exchange in New York and the London Stock Exchange, people who have been briefed on the transaction said last night.

articles.headline: Weiss Indicted in Class-Action Kickback Case
articles.snippet: Melvyn I. Weiss was indicted today in connection with a scheme in which his firm is said to have paid kickbacks to people to serve as named plaintiffs in class-action lawsuits.
articles.abstract: Melvyn I. Weiss was indicted today in connection with a scheme in which his firm is said to have paid kickbacks to people to serve as named plaintiffs in class-action lawsuits.
articles.lead_paragraph: Once a class-action legal juggernaut, the law firm now known as Milberg Weiss suffered more body blows today as federal prosecutors indicted its co-founder Melvyn I. Weiss and secured a plea deal with yet another former partner.

articles.headline: Armed Guards in Iraq Occupy a Legal Limbo
articles.snippet: Recent incidents in Iraq have revealed large gaps in the laws applying to armed contractors.
articles.abstract: Recent incidents in Iraq have revealed large gaps in the laws applying to armed contractors.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Sept. 19  The shooting incident involving private security guards in Baghdad on Sunday that left at least eight Iraqis dead has revealed large gaps in the laws applying to such armed contractors.
articles.byline: By John M. Broder and James Risen

articles.headline: Voices Rise in Egypt to Shield Girls From an Old Tradition
articles.snippet: Circumcision, as supporters call it, or female genital mutilation, as opponents refer to it, was suddenly a ferocious focus of debate in Egypt this summer.
articles.abstract: Circumcision, as supporters call it, or female genital mutilation, as opponents refer to it, was suddenly a ferocious focus of debate in Egypt this summer.
articles.lead_paragraph: KAFR AL MANSHI ABOU HAMAR, Egypt — The men in this poor farming community were seething. A 13-year-old girl was brought to a doctor’s office to have her clitoris removed, a surgery considered necessary here to preserve chastity and honor.

articles.headline: A Minister’s Public Lesson on Domestic Violence
articles.snippet: A domestic violence case involving a television evangelist  has left some questioning her credibility.
articles.abstract: A domestic violence case involving a television evangelist  has left some questioning her credibility.
articles.lead_paragraph: ATLANTA, Sept. 19 — The attack in a hotel parking lot here last month was remarkable not only because the victim, Juanita Bynum, is the most prominent black female television evangelist in the country, who is pals with Oprah, admired by Aretha, and who recently signed on to campaign for Obama.

articles.headline: Deal to Buy Sallie Mae in Jeopardy
articles.snippet: The consortium that had agreed to buy Sallie Mae for $25 billion may scuttle the deal if it is unable to negotiate a lower price.
articles.abstract: The consortium that had agreed to buy Sallie Mae for $25 billion may scuttle the deal if it is unable to negotiate a lower price.
articles.lead_paragraph: Yet another major buyout deal may be on the rocks.
articles.byline: By Andrew Ross Sorkin and Michael J. de la Merced

articles.headline: Beware the Tapeless Camcorder
articles.snippet: Tapeless camcorders have arrived, but be aware of price, capacity and picture quality.
articles.abstract: Tapeless camcorders have arrived, but be aware of price, capacity and picture quality.
articles.lead_paragraph: When geeks sit down to tell their children about nature’s great cycles, they don’t talk about birth and death. They talk about the way bulky gadgets get smaller over time, expensive ones become commodities — and how recording tape always gives way to digital storage.

articles.headline: In Crisis, 2 Fed Chiefs Seem Alike
articles.snippet: While many expected Ben S. Bernanke to bring a different style to the Federal Reserve, in practice Mr. Bernanke is remarkably similar to his predecessor, Alan Greenspan.
articles.abstract: While many expected Ben S. Bernanke to bring a different style to the Federal Reserve, in practice Mr. Bernanke is remarkably similar to his predecessor, Alan Greenspan.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Sept. 19  From the moment that Ben S. Bernanke, a former academic, succeeded Alan Greenspan, a longtime Washington insider, as chairman of the Federal Reserve, it seemed clear that he would bring a different style to the august central bank.
